Watching John Cassavetes film, Opening Night, I was reminded of something that Quentin Tarantino said once in an interview about personal experience in being a creator. He said:
“I haven’t done anything nearly as hard as what this has been since I’ve been starring in movies, and you hate the idea that what you do isn’t valid. And I hate to have to give up the possibility that some day I might be returned to my natural state of doing just movies.”
